a_about_mcm:
MathCityMap is a project of the working group MATIS I (IDMI, Goethe-University Frankfurt Main).
 MCM consists of an app and a web portal. After a short registration the MathCityMap web portal (www.mathcitymap.eu) offers users the possibility to create own tasks and trails, which later on can be accessed from the app. Furthermore trails can be downloaded as a PDF-file from the web portal. All MathCityMap tools are free. 

 Responsible persons:
 Matthias Ludwig
 Iwan Gurjanow
 Joerg Zender

  MathCityMap uses images of https://icons8.com:
 https://icons8.com/web-app/5682/marker
 https://icons8.com/web-app/2969/settings-filled
 https://icons8.com/web-app/13114/cancel
 https://icons8.com/web-app/5575/plus
 https://icons8.com/web-app/16570/exit
 https://icons8.com/web-app/5663/worldwide-location
 https://icons8.com/web-app/5594/key 
 https://icons8.com/web-app/6269/waypoint-map
 https://icons8.com/web-app/13115/ok

a_about_mcm_project: MathCityMap is a project of the working group MATIS I (IDMI, Goethe-University Frankfurt Main).
a_about_mcm_portal: MCM consists of an app and a web portal. After a short registration the MathCityMap web portal (www.mathcitymap.eu) offers users the possibility to create own tasks and trails, which later on can be accessed from the app. Furthermore trails can be downloaded as a PDF-file from the web portal. All MathCityMap tools are free.

a_private_session_quit_text: Do you really want to quit the Session?
a_terms_and_conditions_text: By joining a session I understand and agree that for the time of the session. information will be shared with the mathcitymap.eu server. The used information includes location and current trail progress data. Only the session leader has access to the transmitted data to organize the digital math trail classroom. The data will be deleted after 3 months. Read more on data protection here.
p_cookie_message: This website stores cookies on your computer to guarantee a good and personalized user experience. Furthermore, we (in accordance with the European Data Protection Regulation) collect usage statistics during your visit. Would you like to allow MathCityMap to collect usage statistics?
p_session_really_kick: You are about to remove the participant '{{USER}}'. Continue?
a_session_return_text: You are still a part of a digital classroom. Do you want to return to the classroom or to leave it?
p_drag_drop: Change the order via drag and drop.
p_session_info_click_to_add: Click on a task to add it as a starting task.
p_help_leaderboard: Enable this option to let participants of the digital classroom see a local leaderboard inside the MCM app. The leaderboard shows the score of the current team as well as the score of the team above and below them. This option adds a competetive feature to the math trail.
p_help_assign_tasks: Enable this option to automatically assign a starting task when a group joins the digital classroom. If this option is enabled, participants may only start from the assigned task. The option to view all tasks or to select an other starting task will be hidden in the MCM app. Disable this option to let groups decide where to start.
p_help_assign_progressive: This assignment mode assigns tasks in a sequential way. The first group will be assigned the first task, the second group the second task and so on. If there are more groups than tasks the system will start at the first task again.
p_help_assign_uneven_first: This assignment mode skips in the beginning every second task. First, only the uneven tasks will be assigned. The advantage comes to play when only a few group participate in the trail, because there will be buffer tasks available. The system continues to assign also the even tasks when more groups join.
p_help_assign_user_defined: This assignment mode allows the author to customize the order of the task assignment or even to exclude tasks from being automatically assigned. Rearrange the list of available task via drag and drop.
p_r_help_gamification: If this option is disabled, no points will be awarded for solved tasks.
p_r_help_validation: If this option is disabled, solutions can not be entered. App users may manually mark tasks as finished by clicking on the "finish" button.
p_r_help_saso: If this option is disabled, no sample solutions can be retrieved.
p_r_help_hints: If these option is disabled, no hints can be taken.

p_gpsTasks_info_howTo_coordSys_msg2: To solve this task, the app user has to find two points within the defined coordinate system that match the entered equation.

p_review_guidelines_info: The following guidelines will be used during the review process
p_review_guidelines_imgs_info: I am in possession of the rights of the used media.
p_guideline_task_1: The image identifies the target object without any doubt.
p_guideline_task_2: The task is formulated in a clear and precise manner. In particular, the unit, in which the answer should be given, is indicated (e.g. length in metres).
p_guideline_task_3: The sample solution describes at least one way how to determine the solution. In particular, the gathered measurements and the formulas that were used for the calculation are indicated.
p_guideline_task_4: The hints are clear and formulated in a precise manner. They offer helpful hints to solve the task.
p_guideline_task_5: The task can only be solved on-site. In particular, it must not be possible to solve the task only looking at the task picture or by only reading the hints. Furthermore, at least one activity must be carried out to solve the task (e.g. measuring or counting).
p_guideline_task_6: The decision for a particular answering format (multiple choice, exact solution or interval) seem plausible. If solving the task requires measurments, one must choose the answering format interval. The size of the interval must be sufficient to account for acceptable differences in measurements ("Measuring errors"). At the same time, the solution cannot be guessed.
p_guideline_trail_1: The math trail contains a meaningful title and an appealing title image.
p_guideline_trail_2: There is a meaningful short description of the trail ("About the trail") in which the target group (e.g. grade 7) is mentioned. Additionally it can contain information regarding the location of the task (e.g. suitable for wheelchairs, traffic-calmed sector).
p_guideline_trail_3: The tasks can be reached by foot within an appropriate time span. This also applies for the first and last task: The tasks thus form a circular route.
p_review_in_check_info: This content is currently being reviewed. The review is conducted manually and can thus take several days. You will receive an e-mail and be informed in the publication area.
p_pdf_settings_date: Set date on the title page
p_content_cancel_edit_info: Are you sure that you want to return to the previous page? Unsaved data will be lost.
p_about_code_info: Using the code, a private trail can be played in the MCM app. To do so, you need to click on the plus button within the MCM app and enter the code into the search field.
p_about_visibility_info: Private content can only be viewed and edited by the owner. Further, it can be shared with a group or per link via the "Sharing" menu. Click on the "World" button to publish the trail.

p_error_no_blanks: At least one blank is required!
p_blanks_instructions_blanks: Blanks must be marked with a double asterisk (**) before and after a word.
p_blanks_instructions_alternatives: Alternative solutions are separated by a slash (/).
p_blanks_instructions_example: An equilateral triangle has three angles of **equal/same** size. Each angle is **60** degrees.
p_task_info_description: This task type aims to inform the user about the object or the current site. The user is not required to perform any action to complete the task.
a_onboarding_slide1_text: With MathCityMap you can walk trails in your environment and get to know both math and your environment from a whole new perspective!
a_onboarding_slide2_text: Discover trails in your area using the list or map. To find a specific trail use the search or add function with code.
a_onboarding_slide3_text: Did you find the right trail? Download directly and start offline at any time! Do not forget to switch on your GPS ;).
a_onboarding_slide4_text: Solve tasks and collect points. And if you get stuck, a hint will help!
a_onboarding_slide5_text: Get up to a hundred points. You will receive direct feedback and can take a look at the sample solution.
p_error_empty_name_field: Name field can't be left empty
p_blanks_check_explanation_description: The check type determines how much the app user's input may differ from the given solution in order to still be counted as "correct". We are using the Levenstein distance to calculate the number of differences.
p_blanks_check_explanation_strict: Strict: The input must match with the solution.
p_blanks_check_explanation_normal: Normal: The input can vary by up to 20%.
p_blanks_check_explanation_easy: Easy: The input can vary by up to 40%.
p_set_explanation: The solution set can contain several elements. This task format is suitable, for example, to realize tasks for determining all zeros of a quadratic function.
fts_no_results_warning: Please check spelling and / or adjust the advanced search parameters and try again.
p_session_one_start_for_all: All start with the same task
p_session_help_exclusive_initial_task: All participants start with the same initial task.

Simon Barlovits
Jos Fabiunke
p_r_tasks_gaps: Please make sure that the distance between the tasks should be about the same. Perhaps you will find an interesting object between tasks with a very large distance or you can adjust the task sequence.
p_r_route_line: Please make sure that the first and last tasks of your trail are as close to each other as possible and that the remaining tasks form a circuit if possible. This makes it much easier to organize the execution of the trail. To do this, you can always "skip" a task on the way there. The skipped tasks are then worked on on the way back.
p_r_route_roundtrip: Please make sure that the first and last tasks of your trail are as close to each other as possible and that the remaining tasks form a circuit if possible. This makes it much easier to organize the execution of the trail.
p_r_route_high_range: Your tasks are currently scattered over too large an area, so that the trail seems hard to complete coherently in a reasonable amount of time. Choose your route so that the trail can be completed on foot without any problems.
p_r_description_precision: Please write the short description ("About this trail") in such a way that all information necessary for the selection of a trail is included, esp. target group, subject area, etc. Furthermore, you can include information about the location of the trail (e.g. wheelchair accessible, traffic-calmed area, open to the public, etc.).
p_r_title_expressiveness: Choose the title of your trail in a way that makes it clear to other users what your trail is about. This can be an interesting place (e.g. "About Frankfurt's RÃ¶mer") or clarify the topic ("Linear functions on the banks of the Main").
p_r_internet: In general, tasks that require Internet research are feasible. However, Internet access would then be mandatory, which we do not normally require. You should keep this in mind during the realization.
p_r_wiz_tasks: To create your task, you can use our task wizard. If you don't know our task wizard yet (you can find it under: new task/task wizard), I would like to introduce it to you briefly: With the wizard you can create tasks about ramp gradient or the age of trees with only a few clicks - the system provides the hints automatically and calculates the sample solution from your data.
p_r_formula_editor: I would like to refer you to our small formula editor (left of the input window; marked with omega) for writing the task, the sample solution or the hints. This makes it possible, for example, to write cm2 as cmÂ².
p_r_language: Please also pay attention to linguistic correctness for tasks to be published.
p_r_hint_understandable: Currently, your hints are difficult for users to follow. Formulate the hints in such a way that they provide food for thought or lead to a possible solution path.
p_r_hint_concrete: In your hints, refer to a possible procedure for solving the task. Also indicate any formulas that may be required.
p_r_hint_direct_solution: The hints of your task currently already reveal so much information that the task can be solved from home. Please adjust your hints so that the task can only be solved on site.
p_r_solution_interval_short: Please revise your solution interval.Your solution interval seems to me to be a little narrow.  Consider which measurement errors could occur during data collection or which are still acceptable. Adjust the interval limits accordingly. General rule for medium sized objects: Deviation of +-3% per measured value for green interval and +-7% per measured value for orange interval.
p_r_solution_interval_big: Please revise your solution interval. Since the required data is relatively easy to collect from the object, you can reduce both the orange and the green interval. Consider which measurement errors could occur during data collection or which are still acceptable. Adjust the interval limits accordingly. General rule for medium sized objects: Deviation of +-3% per measured value for green interval and +-7% per measured value for orange interval.
p_r_answer_format: Since minor errors cannot be avoided and are not bad while collecting the required data, you should not work with exact values when entering the result. So working with solution intervals is a good option here. Please adjust your solution format accordingly.
p_r_sample_solution_short: Your sample solution is still too undetailed for anyone to be able to follow your solution path without any doubt. Please describe your approach to solving the problem as clearly as possible. In particular, state the data collected from the object and all the formulas required.
p_r_sample_solution_incorrect: An error has occurred in your sample solution. Please check your calculation method. Adjust the sample solution and the result (answer format).
p_r_image_local_solvable: An important characteristic of MathCityMap tasks is that they can only be solved on site - as learning mathematics in motion. However, this does not apply to your task: I can already solve it from home by looking at your picture.
p_r_task_local_solvable: An important characteristic of MathCityMap tasks is that they can only be solved on site - as learning mathematics in motion. However, this does not apply to your task: I can already solve it from home by reading your task text.
p_r_image_purpose: Your image does not make it absolutely clear which object the task refers to. Please crop the image appropriately or mark the relevant object with an image editor.
p_r_task_unit: Name the desired unit in the task.
p_r_task_purpose: Please be more precise in describing your task. Currently, there could still be misunderstandings about the goal of the task.
p_r_too_much_info: At MathCityMap, we like to set tasks that are as authentic as possible. However, your task seems a bit artificial. Please check if you can do without the context.
p_r_task_accepted:
Hello {{username}},

Thank you very much for creating this great task.
We are happy to publish it.
Keep up the good work and have fun with MathCityMap!

Best regards
{{reviewer}}
p_r_trail_accepted:
Hello {{username}},

thank you very much creating this great trail.
We are happy to publish it.
Keep up the good work and have fun with MathCityMap!

Best regards
{{reviewer}}
p_r_short_answer_format: Exact answer format instead of interval
p_r_own_review: - {{ Insert your own feedback in bullet points here }}
p_r_own_review_warning: Caution: Please write your own review after all desired checkboxes have been selected. Your own feedback will be overwritten when you select another checkbox.
p_r_task_rejected:
Hello {{username}},

Thank you for creating this task. However, before we can publish it, you would need to make a few adjustments.
We still have the following points to note:



Please revise the task with regard to the points of criticism mentioned and resubmit the request for publication.

Thank you and best regards
{{reviewer}}
p_r_trail_rejected:
Hello {{username}},

Thank you for creating this trail. However, before we can publish it, you would need to make a few adjustments.
We have the following points to note:



Please revise the trail with regard to the points of criticism mentioned and resubmit the request for publication.

Thank you and best regards
{{reviewer}}
